snippet: A recent Saturday afternoon visit prompted by curiosity revealed lessons on how the opening nearly two years ago of Resorts World Casino changed a community.
abstract: Ginia Bellafante Big City column asserts that 2011 opening of Resorts World Casino near South Ozone Park, Queens, has negatively affected neighborhood life and businesses, despite promises of benefit; says changes that casino has wrought should serve as cautionary tale for Gov Andrew M Cuomo's plan to open three large casinos in upstate New York.
lead_paragraph: A recent Saturday afternoon visit prompted by curiosity revealed lessons on how the opening nearly two years ago of Resorts World Casino changed a community.

headline.print_headline: In Queens, a Bet Gone Bad
headline.main: In Queens, a Casino Bet Gone Bad
